intro: Harpalyce nipensis var. lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceleaf harpalyce, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in sandy or well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
